p: The antibacterial activities of the methanol extracts of L. inermis, A. aspera and A. indica leaves were tested against microorganisms isolated from the wounds of patients with lymphoedema and standard ATCCs. In vitro antibacterial activity was tested in the presence or absence of a zone of inhibition in diameter, the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) and minimum bactericidal concentration (MBC) in comparison with the reference antibacterial drugs.
